subject: Re: [junit] How to capture junit test reports
msgSnippet: If u r using the junit task of ant, u can acheive the xml or txt output using the default formatters the ant provides. (u ll have to use a
messageBody:
If u r using the 'junit' task of ant, u can acheive
the xml or txt output using the default formatters the
ant provides. (u'll have to use a <formatter> element
for this within the junit task, specifying the
formatter class and extention).
If u want to enhance ur xml reports into html, u can
make use of the 'junitreport' task which helps
convertion of the xml reports to html based on a few
stylesheets.


--- Erik Mattsson <erik.mattsson@...> wrote:
> One way is to dump the output into a textfile using
> "java -cp tests.jar;junit.jar com.foo.TestCase >
> textfile.txt".
> This is probably the simplest way but is not good in
> any way. The best way I think is to use
> ANT for this, in ant you can generate text-, html-
> and XML- files from the testcases. The html
> pages are pretty good, they show if anything went
> bad and it is simple to find the testmethod that
> failed.
>
> Check out the JUNIT target at the ant.apache.org
> website. If you want I can send
> you our complete ANT script to compile and run
> tests.
>
> //Erik
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: Srivastava, Pradeep
> To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com'
> Sent: Monday, September 22, 2003 7:36 AM
> Subject: [junit] How to capture junit test reports
>
>
> Hi all,
>
>
> I am new to junit, pls tell me how can I capture
> the output of junit tests
> and put them in a text file or an html file for
> all cases of success,
> failures or errors. I need to show this to the
> client claiming that our
> system is passing all the unit tests cases. I am
> using junit without ANT.
>
> pls send me some sample script if possible ..
>
> Thanks and Regards
> Pradeep
